page.title: 13Farming in our area.
page.content: Most farms are about 1000 acres of land and cattle are kept for milk and beef. About half the farmland is used for grazing and the rest of the farmland is used for crops such as barley,oats and wheat. Eastbrook Farm (Bishopstone) has one field of daffodils. Mr.Peploes farm at Idstone has 1178 pigs and 393 cows. The steepest slopes of the combs are only used for rough grazing for cattle and sheep. The wooded areas are used as windbreaks but were, in the past, used as winter shelters for cattle. The names of the farms of our study in Ashbury are College Farm,Kingstone Farm and Manor Farm. In Idstone there are Elm Tree Farm, Rectory Farm and Idstone Farm. At Bishopstone the farms are called Forty Farm,Eastbrook Farm,Manor Farm,Cue's Farm and Prebendal Farm.Most were leased to farmers by the church
